cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (forecast to become a hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica and 210 miles SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, crossing western Cuba Friday, then turning north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coast, with major-hurricane strength expected before landfall
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near the Mississippi River Delta/Buras–Port Fourchon area)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast at Advisory #1 (only Cayman Islands and western Cuba under watch consideration)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands and the Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, Havana, Artemisa, Pinar del Rio, and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern U.S. Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to Alabama, with highest risk along southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are 63 % likely; hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) cannot be ruled out (8-9 % at 64 kt level).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening storm surge along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent coastal areas as the system approaches major-hurricane strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands expected to spread into southeast Louisiana Sunday night and Monday with 6–10 inches possible inland toward Baton Rouge, causing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding on the Mississippi and its tributaries, hazardous marine/river currents, and possible tornadoes in rain bands once the system is inland.
